bzomARL7St24lJSgna4FYg.text: excellent and intimate, a real find. It is small you take your chances if you drop in on spec, however you can book in advance if you have a party night in mind.

K4TWRrwdqeZ9XPswmxa_RA.text: Great atmosphere and great food!   I ate here with my cousin when I tagged along on her recent business trip to London and apparently she eats here whenever she is in London.   We sat in the window, enjoyed wine and nibbled at the different tapas dishes came out.   They keep bringing out new dishes so eat slowly and and wait to see what else is coming out.   If I lived in London, this would definitely be a go to spot for me

RIlajKQmMQSC_vY9wLa78g.text: This tiny tapas bar opened recently in Covent Garden, taking the place of one of Neal Street's old cake shops. Initially it doesn't look like much - the few tapas samples sitting out in the window didn't particularly tempt me - but having been persuaded in by a friend I was very glad I gave it a try. The wine here is served in authentic Spanish style stemless glasses, and is probably the best thing about Pix. There's a good selection of top quality stuff, at reasonable prices. The pintxos themselves are also pretty good, tasty and fresh, and made a great accompaniment to the wine. The best time to visit this branch of Pix is in the summer, when you can sit out on the pavement in the bustle of Neal Street's shoe shopping crowd. We felt like we could easily have been in Madrid or Barcelona as we say there enjoying Pintxos on a sunny spring day. Great for an antidote to shopping! Pix gets pretty busy and lively on Friday and Saturday nights, so be there early to avoid disappointment (table space is quite limited). But the staff are really accommodating and offered us two whole plates of free tapas after a bottle of wine (which they also replaced) was corked. Definitely above the call of duty!

5SJDq3s8DDikcnZtJ8Efpw.text: Great tapas, really friendly staff and great cocktail and wine list.

photos.caption: Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom

YniRYlYAKgdEtZkBz5ppoA.text: Great place to stop by if you can't decide what to eat, but want to try everything! I haven't come across many pintxos places here in London, but Pix is definitely a good find. Situated in the middle of a bunch of shoe shops in Covent Garden, it's quite unassuming. Would recommend checking it out at lunch or early evening so you can snatch a seat. The pintxos were about £2.50-3, complemented by a stellar wine list. The staff are very nice as well. I'm kind of hoping that it doesn't get too popular because it is such a cute, small space!

HKFs91qD7QmteQFYwtkElA.text: Tip top! Great way to serve  self service tapas and a relaxed atmosphere. Wine glasses could use a polish! Great place for a date

23cBIEFYo75z4yKL4QNq0Q.text: Fun and relaxed atmosphere.  Good food and wine - I loved the way the tapas were spread out on the bar for people to pick what they want.  This is a great place for a drink, a snack, or both!

UyNcTWnn-lj76Cs_m3tjpA.text: Had such a great time here! The food was good (not mind-blowing, but good!), the place is crowded, but fun. It's a nice, affordable, buzzy place. Really enjoyed it.

RpOD90FBs8gv__lyB2_YTA.text: I went to Pix with my Spanish girlfriend on Thursday 18.11.2010 at about 10pm. We went in and asked for a Mojito. Alas, no mint was left. So we asked for a Caipi. The guy at the bar took the 'phone, made a call and told us that there was no lime left. That was when we left.

F3a-0P2Gnj-bOcuoDLyMZg.text: My partner came across this place.There two Pix Bars in London. We went to the Pix Bar at Soho, the other one is at Covent Garden. There used to be another one in Westbourne Grove as well, but it is now closed down. Another bar/cafe has taken its place. Every time I pass by, it is packed. It must be good. I am sure to pay a visit there sometime too. We got there around 3pm, so lunch time was over and it was pretty empty. I heard it does get really busy during lunch and dinner times. For the price and the food served, Pix-Bar will be on low-mid end food bar. Food was well made and tasted good, however nothing to shout about. Very affordable. Within £30 we able to have 8 pintxos and half a bottle of Manzanilla. Excellent place to get together with some friends for some drinks and nibbles. Definitely recommend it. I will definitely come here again. However, I will also like to try its sister bar at Covent Garden. I will write all about it when I do. thehungrybea.com/2012/02… TheHungryBea.com

IYA5_8ioAv6dAZN7L2lKpQ.text: This is one of those places you almost don't want to review in case a barrage of new business ruins the experience, but on the other hand, it deserves the credit. What an awesome place  there are others, one in soho, but the atmosphere, the gorgeous and friendly staff, the food and the mojitos make this place unbeatable. Based around Catalan tapas, the food is to die for, and the idea of each dish having a tooth"pick" which is how they charge for the food, genius. Highly recommend the meatball dish and fried balls! I now come here about once a fortnight and it's great for dates/ informal business meetings/ or catching up with friends. Try and get a table near the front though,the back can be quite loud if there's a party on.

i9Xd57ceBocGfWhrgFYFdw.text: Went to pix in soho on Thursday! Great place! Really nice atmosphere, great food affordable and super friendly staff! Will be back!

YPjt7QaaHB2xJvb2zW8HAw.text: The tapas are fresh and tasty. The service is very spanish just like the wine. I will definitely be back when return to London.

KJS60xjXEXlfEdAWW6nnnw.text: What can I say I am writing this 13 months later! Because I forgot the name of the place- the night was that good... and i saw a yelp friend check in here and it all came flooding back... we wandered in here on new years eve because we didnt want to want for Barrafina and wow we had such a great night... Pinxhos and wine and cocktails it was as good as it gets, if looking for a tapas night in central london you would be hard pushed to find a better experience...

zfJfsrrWKvzfvr7gUj4d3Q.text: Came her with my girlfriend. The atmosphere was very Spanish (which I love). The staff, even though very rushed, ensured that every need was answered.The food was amazing and their wine recommendation was ideal.If want a funky after work place to get a bite, this is the place for you.

Uxc4Yyy_9_-5AwFvQHDN4A.text: Yummy tapas and they are open until 12. Hard-working, professional and friendly staff.

Ysngk6W5GxmhNy6qSe24bA.text: Inspired by the pintxo bars of Barcelona, Pix offers loads of different food options with only two prices. Those with small sticks sticking out of them cost £2.25 and the big ones £3.25 which makes adding up your bill super simple. After a couple portions of patatas bravas to share between us while we waiting for drinks we checked out the days offerings.I went with the Serrano ham on tomato bread, diablo meatballs, Serrano ham & bechemal croquetas and the four cheese fritter. Some items were better than others and while the meatballs were delicious the bread that came with it and also the Serrano ham was a bit of a let down. My absolute favourite dish however were the cheese fritters, crispy on the outside while still being wonderfully gooey on the inside - truly delicious!I could have quite happily gone back for more but of course wanted to save room for not only the cava we were drinking but a cheeky little pudding too! The churros with chocolate sauce were the bomb and an absolute bargain at the short stick price.I may have got sugar absolutely EVERYWHERE trying to eat these in a half polite manner but man were they worth it. The sauce wasn't really a sauce though, more like milkshake which made an excellent chaser at the end of the meal. In total the bill came to around £20 each including drinks which for central London is pretty much unheard of.  I for one am a definite convert!

3DnbKsS3jELjt7pEB14JGQ.text: Great post theater option in the West End!  I'm never sure how hungry I will be, nor how hungry my guests might be, after a show, and this is a delicious way to bridge that.  Everyone can help themselves, and the options for the pinchos are varied by size and type, so there are choices to suit the entire party.  We had such a good meal we stopped into their location near our flat in Notting Hill later in the week.  Will look forward to returning.

YaL3j3IxGWolrXkXLLr9vg.text: Pix is a very decent tapas bar mini-chain exclusive to London. I've visited the Covent Garden (Neal St) and Notting Hill locations. The concept is great. You sit down, make yourself comfortable, maybe order a drink from the waiter, then get up to pick out your tapas. They offer a range of traditional tapas like albondigas, cured meats, chorizo and vegetable options which are all skewered. You collect skewers as you go, making as many trips as you'd like to the counter with the constantly replenished food. At the end, you pay for skewers and drinks and voila. It's a great option if you want some authentic tapas at your own pace.I generally like the concept of Pix, but beware, the space is very small and can feel like you're packed like sardines in a can or the tube on your morning commute, so not always the most pleasant of dining experiences. I wouldn't recommend this for groups (unless you book out the entire restaurant), and would always advise booking ahead.

L_XjfAfyHYAlvTaLEp6UKA.text: VERY excited about this place! Went on Saturday night-- just reserved 30 minutes ahead of time and had no problem once we got there (2 of us). The tapas are DELICIOUS. They really do have something for everyone. It's very reasonably priced and the wine was light and perfectly crisp. We didn't feel rushed at all and the service was satisfactory. Will definitely go back here if I get the chance, I was so pleasantly surprised at how much I loved it! The ambiance is quite romantic and although it is a small space, I didn't feel crowded even though we were seated right near the entrance. 5 stars for this gem.

ifWPCWncc9Xwl7mgRze5gQ.text: My American fiancé was visiting and we were stumbling around covent garden when we discovered Pix!This place has a really unique concept. Everything is in small portions and you can pick up which food items you want to eat from the bar area. The total cost depends on the number of cocktail sticks that you accumulate. I think they may need a better system for this- it's a little too trusting in my opinion since it would be easy enough for customers to discard the sticks and avoid paying the full cost of what they ate (!) In addition to the yummy tapas, there is also a good drink selection.Note that the restaurant is very small and more suited to small groups of 2/3!

5so_kUWLYGJUtCn5cTIXHA.text: Always a bit hard to review a tapas place without having tried all the tapas but suspect my taste buds would probably have commuted mass suicide at any more boredom ...Oh and my bank account would have been drained of all resources to feed me again...It seems Soho is not the only place to have restaurant s that leave one feeling poor and hungry ...Suspect the best bits of this place are the fact one can sit in the street drinking wine and watching the world go by without looking like one is homeless ...The most insulting part of a serve yourself restaurant is being charged service charge ... They are quick to remove it ... So maybe just cheeky ...

9W2N0AFYZkuH4F-daCD6LA.text: This made my trip last time I was in London. I already love tapas restaurants, but I think this place really takes the cake! The decor is cozy and perfect, and the tapas are just laid out in front of you when you come in so you can just drool over all the yummy choices. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable, and the prices are not outrageous. It makes for a great combination of a place that anyone who is a fan of wine and tapas should try, hands down!

gXWn1f6fP2gXE5RKcxgRUg.text: This concept is totally refreshing and I'd love to see something similar stateside. The decor is done right - exposed filament lighting, lots of what appears to be reclaimed wood and the entire front of the space is glass so you can people watch as shoppers pass through Covent Garden. It is b r i l l i a n t!!!Numerous savory and sweet dishes are laid out for your enjoyment - tapas style! Every small dish that we sampled was full of flavor. My only complaint is that at the time there were a large amount of fritters, which are of course fried...BUT all the food is on a rotation so you can just sit back and enjoy another glass of wine while you wait for some new selections.The following items were consumed (in order of tastiness): - Seared Tuna on toasted bread- Chorizo w/ manchego Cheese- Ham and tomato on toasted bread (lovely thing strips of smoked ham)- Spinach and Sweet Potato 'cakes'- Aubergine Fritter w/ Cherry Tomato- Olives and tomatosThere is a bit of an honor system involved. Each selection comes with a 'pick' stuck in them and this is how your meal is totalled up at the end of your grazing session. I highly recommend this spot - if you are in the area you MUST try it.

ei64xQsF3F1vOrnTjf1MkA.text: I am so close to rating Pix a 5 had it not been for the service charge they added to the bill. This is a lovely little tapas bar close to Neals Yard in Covent Garden area. You pick your food from the layout on the bar - if it has a big stick it costs £3.25 and if it has a little stick it costs £2.25. The food was delicious, fantastic value for money. I had a potato omlette with Parma ham, a four cheese fritter thing, a pesto and Serrano ham bread nibble and a chicken skewer with a chilli and yoghurt dressing... YUM! We were served our drinks fairly promptly too, a delicious bottle of the house rose wine, and despite it being a Saturday and busy, it didn't feel crowded in the restaurant which i really liked. I would highly recommend for a visit if you fancy stress-free afternoon nibbles and drinks but I was really disappointed about the extra £8 charge on top of our £40-odd bill for the 3 of us, especially as we had served ourselves.

YiZTqx4Sn-B4OliAqpYmpQ.text: I love the concept of this place! The space itself is well designed, the drink options are well thought out, and the little tapas are all really flavorful!We popped in on a whim, grabbed a glass of wine, and sampled about 5 different items. You get to go up to the bar and pick up the plates of the dishes you want (each is just a few bites), and the idea is that you collect your sticks as you go which are then added up at the end for your tab. Simplest is always best and we loved the jamon on the toast. Perfect way to start a night of bar hopping in Soho!

WfzlIKkON38J2Q6pxXsPgw.text: Love this pinxto stuff even if I can't pronounce it. You know the deal here, there are sticks with stuff on the end, like roles with Iberian ham, chorizo and cheese, croquetas.  You eat what you want, graze, pick up something here, something there and at the end of lunch the waiter counts up your cocktail sticks. In Spain this is a very cheap way of having a leasurely meal.  In Spain, these thingies cost €1 - €1.50, this is London so they cost £2 - £3.  Figure on Spending £15-20 not including drinks.  The tapas/pinxtos are actually rather good.

WGE9-W8x_PcK5BAVU8wR0Q.text: Having been to Bilbao in northern Spain and experienced the local Pinchos bars this is the first time I have found something similar in London.  These bars are basically like wine bars that have plates of single portion foods laid out on the bar.  You ask for a plate and then take items from the bar without paying.  Pinchos means spike, so all the food is served with a stick in it, this means you settle up when you leave by handing back the sticks from the food you've had.The food I had was ok, but not to the same standard as that in Spain.  There was a fairly limited wine selection too, perhaps 5 bottles of red.  Still very nice to find a little taste of Spain like this in London.

xTdAXcPzk3g0eB6Pkl-odg.text: My love of cold food is well documented. To clarify, I love, love, love spicy food. I just like the temperature of my food cold. Spicy cold food. Sounds disgusting. Tastes delicious.So you can imagine my excitement when I walked into Pix for a quick lunchtime nibble and rather then having to wait for my tapas to arrive, there were an array of Basque-style pintxos sitting and waiting to be plucked up from the bar. Plump juicy olives, meatballs, quince-coated chorizo on manchego cheese, pork belly with apple and smoked potato, cod and crab croquetas, Iberico ham and zucchini... and that was just in the initial grab-sesh. I noticed a beautiful display of Spanish wines, and as we were the only people sitting along the window, we got to sample a few cocktails they were testing. Not a bad way to spend an afternoon, hey?  If you've never enjoyed this Northern Spanish treat, pintxos are different from tapas in the way they are presented and eaten. While tapas are more of a sit down, get cosy, fork-frolicing long-term affair, pintxos are more of a social butterfly -- reasonably large, but individual bites consisting of a small slice of bread with a wide variety of Spanish goodness on top, served on a long, thin skewer. (Pintxo = spike. Clever, huh?) If this is blowing your mind, compare pintxos to a sushi-go-round where you're grabbing, nibbling, grabbing again and then being charged per colourful plate, rather than a sit down, order from a menu sushi restaurant. Or you could just go and check it out for yourself! (That goes for Pix and Basque Country alike.)

gg6lFeXQQAf_nfWCTuUiRQ.text: Walked in off the street without any previous knowledge and was pleasantly surprised. The food is displayed at the front of the restaurant and you go up and pick and mix what you want. I was a bit iffy of the idea at the beginning, but once i got eating... It was great ( I even went back up for more). The staff are great and one girl (the manager, I think) even took the time to chat amicably with me during a quiet afternoon. Hope to go back again.

9h60Hx3p29oPxscCOsvcOQ.text: Popped in last Saturday afternoon for our first visit to Pix. A warm welcome and quick explanation of how the stick counting works from the young lad on duty. We had window seats at the very front of the restaurant, which was just perfect for people watching.Had some lovely cocktails and the tapas was great. More fresh food was delivered up to the bar every few minutes and I had to really stop myself from over-indulging.Would have given 5 stars but the barman completely forgot to bring us a round of drinks. He was very apologetic when I eventually managed to get his attention and remind him and they were all rushed off their feet. But overall, very good.

iSDlRIIAm99EtSlD9mJpjQ.text: Always a favourite, with a wide variety of good food. All cheesy tapas are a must, but be careful not to be carried away otherwise out will end up to be an expensive night. Reservation might be necessary as it's mostly busy.

bIJRU_jCcQ-SFAqqJy5S4A.text: The best food I had in London -- no lie.  And I at in the Ivy and a few other notable places.  Attractive, friendly, addictive -- and a really nice white sangria.  Loved the anchovies and toast and the little meatballs in partic.  And it doesn't break the wallet.  go.

D60ywNMgNDE1DOWvV81fVA.text: Great find on first day in London. The all you can tapas for 15pds was amazing. The food is very tasty and presentation is lovely. Small place but was slow so not an issue. The staff is friendly and even brought some tapas out to us hot out of the kitchen before sitting out on the bar area for all the customers. You serve yourself and go back as often as you want. They have small desserts on the bar too.

photos.caption: Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom

ZFEt6laIMJCOurPfnJgN6g.text: A small but inviting tapas bar. The food is delicious & tastes fresh. There is a wide selection of alcoholic drinks available as well as the usual soft drinks. The staff are very friendly & helpful. It is a great spot to people watch on warm days especially from the couple of outside tables.

photos.caption: Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom. A shot of some of the food & the drinks available.

3VMSMkdUpPYpPNFUdGS09Q.text: Awesome pintxos, in flavor & variety! You pay by the pintxo and it's a self serve style situation. Loved sitting outside under the lights of carnaby street! Either order beer or skip the drinks - red wine wasn't great & the mojitos are incredibly sweet. Otherwise, we loved this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom

hZQ0lR-WiJbWqGoV8B_ZNA.text: Cute place, nice and moody for easy munching and boozing. I guess they were trying to go off the Basque version of pinchos here.  But only part suggesting it was the name and the bite sized portions speared through with a wooden toothpick.  Very limited selection of tapas style nibbles.  The hot foods sit under a heat lamp sort of fixture and are your basics like patatas con chorizo and croquettas. "Pintxos" were displayed with vibrant colors and bits of this and that. The ones sitting on toast left much to be desired. Drinks menu and bar was decent though, nice place to catch up without much hassle.

s8TCdE4yo-YRFH6PMFKsJg.text: Walked by in the early evening one evening, there were some lovely looking platters of food and a table for me.Just what I needed, this taste of Spain. So flavorful and so very well prepared. Wines are excellent.Nice staff, and helpful, tooEnjoy!

HiYpawDfozI5FLM3RpTGvQ.text: Pix is a solid choice for a little pre-or-post theatre imbibing and eating. Skip the stuffy "prix fixe" offered elsewhere around here. Covent Garden houses a lot of wolves in sheep's clothing. It seems tempting, but often disappointing. Yes, you'll be in and out in time for the show -- but at what expense? Lost quality, I tell you. Rawr. So, Pix. A petite little alcove on Neal Street, positioned perfectly to whet your whistle and fill your belly. Pix (pinxtos) are small plates. These are all fired up and ready to go for you, immediately. You take what you want, you eat what you can, they tally up the sticks at the end and voila you'll leave pretty satisfied. Oh, and that chocolate espresso mousse? Do not forget to devour one. I implore you. I've been twice, and both times the service is downright cheerful in the best Spanish way. You feel at home, it's a comfortable spot, relaxed. The wine and drinks flow, the food is never late, they whip up fresh batches as things disappear, even doing some rounds to make sure you have what you need. Very enjoyable. I do recommend a booking for busy show nights as they do book up. Tables turn fast, but you don't want to be left without your Pix fix. So, repeat after me. NO PRIX FIXE -- JUST PIX. NO PRIX FIXE - JUST PIX! you got it. *Infinity Sundays - all you can eat and drink for £33/person. Come hungry and thirsty and get your infinity life on.

photos.caption: Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom

-FIu-pCIbQB3yEtLTdLhhQ.text: Love the concept but the food is just meh. Came here because our other 4 options had long waits and we had a show to get to. We stumbled on this place because it had tables available. You get your own food and collect the sticks in a glass, then they add up the sticks when you pay. The fried olives, shishito peppers and meatballs were ok. But the fried cod balls tasted like faintly fishy dough balls and were disappointing. All the bruschetta variations were meh. Nothing stood out as amazing so we didn't even bother with dessert. Unfortunately this isn't a place I'd go to again with so many other places to try in the area.

s3v8ldFO0qT-RXTJFfBQPw.text: Excellent place for a quick drink and some appetizers.  It's self-service for most of the tapas which are combination of classic Spanish tapas and some fusion ones.  New tapas are served every 20 min and so take your time - enjoy your drink and sample a bunch.

S3axVBm8FKLKaHJsA90ADQ.text: Absolutely fab tapas and a quick way to have a perfect meal. We went on New Year's Eve (must get reservations) and were in and out in 1/2 an hour! They kept. Ringing fresh tapas out from the kitchen and so many lovely items to try. This is a concept popular in Spain--not just the tapas, but each item has a stick in it, one of two sizes. At the end, they count up the sticks and that gives you your total. I loved it! And: They have Pimm's behind the bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom. Fab tapas
Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom. Tapas overview
Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom. Tapas

7f6-mUU_6L5ODOV3VbJIPw.text: Great place to go, especially on Sunday for the £33 all you can eat. Love tapas and the service is also really good. The manager is very friendly and warm. Enjoy the food each time we are there.

photos.caption: Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom

d5zsYfF5r4odkm367DO5qA.text: Great food and fun for a Saturday night with friends before heading out. We didn't want a huge meal, so it was nice to pick and choose exactly how much we wanted. Also - A huge thank you to Ruben who tracked me down through open table when i left my glasses behind. He went above and beyond to make sure I got them back - thank you so much! Will definitely be back the next time I'm visiting the area.

CxG1hxo-Sfxigylohv_wgQ.text: This was one of the many cute places on Notting Hill. We stopped here because of the atmosphere; it seemed full of young people and you can't go wrong with tapas.We were seated outside; all the "waitstaff" were young, funny, and friendly. They explained how it works -- you take a plate and whatever you want from the bar and drop the sticks into a can at your table and at the end they tally that to calculate your tab. We started off with the wine they recommended; we weren't super hungry so tapas was perfect. Food-wise, it wasn't amazing. The tapas were decent and looked better than it tasted. Atmosphere-wise, it was good. We spent a long time there and were happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom

UqgThtsbLw6hC_YWrY1kZw.text: Booked a table on the phone an hour before we went there as I had read that the venue was quite small. When we arrived, our table was free and the waitress was very friendly and explained to us how it works in the tapas bar. The tapas were really nice and not too expensive. Also we had a gluten free and vegetarian guest, and the waitress brought food she could have to the table before even putting it where you get the food. We had a bottle (well, we had 3) of rioja which was really nice too. We had a brilliant time, very good tapas and good wine! The waiter and the waitress were delightful. I definitely wants to go back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom. Lunch time pix
Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom

kZ1aslYD8P9UL2i35PHJSQ.text: Pix Pintxos was superb. Basque meets slight S. American flavors. Awesome layout of food. Stocked bar, tantalizing flavors, they let you enjoy yourself!Downside: more tables outside, more wait staff attention, no cloth tables..Ham, peppers, cilantro, lemon, melon, asparagus, cheese offered as amuse bouches. Perfect!Definitely be back.Rebel Review: 4.5 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom

-CHWGODTfyBI0XsjcfQ1nQ.text: Definitely a great concept, I wish we could have a tapas buffet in the US. The food was good, the ideas innovative, but I'm not sure it was worth the price. For every big stick, they charge you £3.5, and small £2.5. Pretty steep!

photos.caption: Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom. Drink was great!
Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom

EA6izjgtQug-_bFzrU2prQ.text: Didn't do the tapas but came for the speakeasy bar downstairs - called Rooms by the hour. Definitely a great idea, you're in cosy little private booths with a curtain to close them off, a dimmer switch to control your lighting and a little TV that shows 70s porn when you press a button. All sounds great so far, and perfect for a date! I think the cocktails themselves let it down a bit though. The bartenders were the same as the restaurant upstairs and clearly not mixologists. Nice, but your average - slightly over sweet and mainstream - fare. If they sorted that out I would be there all the time!

photos.caption: Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom. Posted on the wall in our little booth.

goOOLgKM-uxCYncCNrgzHA.text: Food was good however, this is definitely a 3 pound sign place. If you're American it's probably the most expensive tapas place you'll go to in London due to the tiny sizes.  for average people expect 4 to 6 large pix and a couple small.  Overall, the food was tasty but a severe lack of hot dishes. A great pre- or post-theater snack. Almost everything is on a crustini which is very not Spanish, but has a great fusion flare!

aKZCivKuceF6mZCSIpsB2Q.text: Great concept here, we had a number of items and two bottles of a well priced and tasty tempranillo.  I thought everything was well prepared and the service was very good, but with one exception, one dish that I thought should have been severed hot, The main component was oxtail on crusty bread, this dish was good, but in my opinion it should have been hot.  Overall very solid.I shall return

Oy0czYDmPe8ipsf0x_gyMg.text: I'm a big fan of this place - good food, not too pricey and great if you're in a bit of a hurry.Have been for both work lunch and pre-theatre dinner, both times staff were very friendly. There's a good variety of food and it was topped up regularly.

photos.caption: Photo of Pix - London, United Kingdom
